intro: Lasallea concolor, commonly known as the white-flowered lasallea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes plants such as cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, pale green stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Lasallea concolor is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
